meanings.definition: A type of closure on a bag or container that consists of a zipper running along the top edge.
meanings.sent1: I opened the ziptop of my backpack to get my books.
meanings.sent2: The ziptop on the plastic bag kept the snacks fresh.
meanings.sent3: The ziptop on the lunchbox made a funny sound when I opened it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a ziptop, effortlessly sealing away her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ziptop on the tent made it easy to access our gear.

meanings.definition: To close or seal a bag or container using a zipper along the top edge.
meanings.sent1: She ziptopped her suitcase before heading to the airport.
meanings.sent2: I always ziptop my toiletry bag when traveling.
meanings.sent3: He ziptopped the gift bag with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The chef ziptopped the pastry bag to keep the icing fresh.
meanings.sent5: They ziptop their lunch bags every morning before school.
